data.name: Tonk Card Set Determination
data.description:
In the card game Tonk part of the process is to determine when you have a **set**.  When you have a **set** in your hand you may discard that **set** to the table.  The rules for determining a **set** is that you must have either three or more cards of the same rank, or three or more suited cards in order.

These each count as a set, or sets:

 - A♣ 2♣ 3♣
 - 4♦ 4♥ 4♠
 - 7♥ 8♥ 9♥ T♥ J♥ Q♥
 - K♠ K♣ K♦ K♥
 
The order of ranks are: `A23456789TJQK` and the suits in the deck will be: `♣♦♥♠` *(Note: these US-ASCII characters are not used.  I had to use UTF8* `cdhs`*.  But your code should work either way.)*

*A hand will never have more than 6 cards at any one time, and a set is never less than 3 cards.*

Write a method `TonkSets.get_sets(*cards)` that will take in an Array of cards and determine how many of the cards form a **set** *(if any)* and return `:all` if all cards can make **one set**, or each of the cards that make a **set** (or **sets**) -- always return the most *(max)* cards that make a **set** if not all, or the symbol `:none` if not enough cards form a **set**.

```ruby
include TonkSets
get_sets(%w^7♥ 8♥ 9♥ T♥ J♥ Q♥^) # => :all
get_sets(%w^7♥ 8♥ 9♥ T♠ J♥ Q♥^) # => [['7♥','8♥','9♥']]
get_sets(%w^7♥ 4♦ 4♥ 4♠ Q♥^)    # => [['4♠','4♥','4♦']]
get_sets(%w^7♥ 4♦ 4♥ T♠ J♥^)    # => :none
```
The given order for input won't be sorted; so keep that in mind when implementing the method.  The output result(s) should be sorted with the standard `sort` method. There may be multiple **sets**, and a card may overlap.  As long as the **sets** are listed as seperate **sets** we are not concerned about the shared card being in both **sets** in the output.
